description:
Certificate of Lawfulness for the use of a dwellinghouse for the care of children, in which:
 
1. There is no more than one child receiving care by up to 3 carers (there will always be a carer on the premises; this will be their permanent residence. Dependent on the needs of the child, an additional carer maybe added during the day. There will also be a manager visiting the property 9am - 5pm on a Monday, Wednesday and Friday).

2. The child in care will be aged from 5 to 17 years of age.
decision_conditions: The proposed use of the application site as a dwelling house for the care of children for a maximum of 1 child and a maximum of 6 people overall in the terms described in the application and additional information received would not result in a material change of use from the existing use as a Class C3 dwelling house, even though the proposed use in itself would fall within Use Class C2 of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes Order) 1987 (as amended).  As such, the proposal does not constitute development and so planning permission is not required.

Should the circumstances of the property/occupants and activities change it may be that planning permission would be required. It is the responsibility of the applicant to ensure that the operations associated with 19 Longtown Road, Romford remain lawful.
